intro: Acrolasia solieri, commonly known as the red-flowered acrolasia, is a species of flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its striking red and purple flowers that bloom throughout the dry season. The plant has palmate leaves with five to seven lobes, and its stems are often woody and branched. Acrolasia solieri is typically found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to the arid conditions of its native environment. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
